Cédric Beust ♔ wrote:

> On 7/17/07, J. B. Rainsberger <jbrains762@... 
> <mailto:jbrains762%40gmail.com>> wrote:
>  > > Really? Is this really what you meant to write? Because this happens
>  > > very often, in my experience.
>  >
>  > Exactly what I meant to write. I've wanted to run "the slow tests" or
>  > "the hyperactive tests because of bad configuration code", but never
>  > "the database tests".
> 
> We probably have different experiences, but it's not rare for me that
> running the "database" tests will take, say one hour, while running
> all the slow tests can take ten times as much.

Yep; that's a difference all right. I can't imagine having a test suite 
that takes 10 hours to run.
